peripheral.title: USB

extract.filter: VL:USB OTG FS + USB OTG FS/HS$

peripheral.extract: USB OTG FS + USB OTG FS/HS
peripheral.help_text:
USB (Universal Serial Bus) is widely used to connect either a PC or a USB
device to the microcontroller in full speed mode (FS).

USB (Universal Serial Bus) is widely used to connect either a PC or a USB
device to the microcontroller in full speed mode (FS).

USB (Universal Serial Bus) is widely used to connect either a PC or a USB device
to the microcontroller. It supports USB Device Host On The Go Full Speed

help_text.filter: VL:USB OTG FS + USB OTG FS/HS$

peripheral.help_text:
USB (Universal Serial Bus) is widely used to connect either a PC or a USB device
to the microcontroller. It supports USB Device Host On The Go Full Speed or High Speed.

USB (Universal Serial Bus) is widely used to connect either a PC or a USB device
to the microcontroller. It supports USB Device Host On The Go High Speed.

The USB Type-C / USB Power Delivery interface supports the physical layer of the USB Power Delivery specification.
– Supports Universal Serial Bus Type-C Cable and Connector Specification: Release 1.2, 25 March, 2016
Primary function is the physical layer implementation of the Power Delivery (PD) specification, CC signaling method (not VBUS), so limited to Type-C cables.
